results.title: A 31-Year-Old Female With Postcoital Hemoptysis
results.text_hl: The report mentioned posteriorly directed mild @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008944 @@@mitral regurgitation@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008944 @@@MR@@@) with an @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008944 @@@MR@@@ maximum velocity of 5.68 m/s.

results.title: Effect of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor therapy in mitral regurgitation with normal left ventricular function.
results.text_hl: For the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group the @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008944 @@@MR@@@ fraction dropped by 6.4 +/- 3.5% and for the placebo group it increased by 3.7 +/- 3.2% versus baseline (P < 0.05).

results.title: Differential effects of the angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril versus the beta-adrenergic receptor blocker atenolol on hemodynamics and left ventricular contractile function in experimental mitral regurgitation.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Although @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ significantly reduced preload, its effect on LV contractility was insignificant in experimental @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008944 @@@MR@@@.

citations.NLM: Nemoto S, Hamawaki M, De Freitas G, Carabello BA. Differential effects of the angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril versus the beta-adrenergic receptor blocker atenolol on hemodynamics and left ventricular contractile function in experimental mitral regurgitation. results.title: Ross-Konno procedure: a case study of a newborn.
results.text_hl: The infant's postoperative hospital course was 37 days. @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008944 @@@Mitral regurgitation@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension_Pulmonary @DISEASE_MESH:D006976 @@@pulmonary hypertension@@@ are being managed with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.
